 2129: type_tests() ->
 2130:     [is_boolean,
 2131:      is_integer,
 2132:      is_float,
 2133:      is_number,
 2134:      is_atom,
 2135:      is_list,
 2136:      is_tuple,
 2137:      is_pid,
 2138:      is_reference,
 2139:      is_port,
 2140:      is_binary,
 2141:      is_bitstring,
 2142:      is_function,
 2143:      is_map].
 2144: 
 2145: basic_andalso_orelse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2146:     T = id({type,integers,23,42}),
 2147:     65 = if
 2148: 	     ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (tuple_size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 2149: 	      element(2, T)) == integers ->
 2150: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 2151: 	     true -> error
 2152: 	 end,
 2153:     65 = case [] of
 2154: 	     [] when ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (tuple_size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 2155: 		      element(2, T)) == integers ->
 2156: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T)
 2157: 	 end,
 2158: 
 2159:     42 = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2}),
 2160:     5.0 = basic_rt({vector,{3.0,4.0}}),
 2161:     20 = basic_rt(['+',3,7]),
 2162:     {'Set',a,b} = basic_rt({{'Set',a,b},{'Set',a,b}}),
 2163:     12 = basic_rt({klurf,4}),
 2164: 
 2165:     error = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2,3}),
 2166:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 2167:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 2168:     error = basic_rt({1,2}),
 2169:     error = basic_rt([]),
 2170: 
 2171:     RelProdBody =
 2172: 	fun(R1, R2) ->
 2173: 		if
 2174: 		    (erlang:size(R1) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set'),
 2175: 		    (erlang:size(R2) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set') ->
 2176: 			ok
 2177: 		end
 2178: 	end,
 2179: 
 2180:     ok = RelProdBody({'Set',a,b}, {'Set',a,b}),
 2181: 
 2182:     %% 'andalso'/'orelse' with calls known to fail already at compile time.
 2183:     %% Used to crash the code generator.
 2184:     error = (fun() ->
 2185: 		     R = {vars,true},
 2186: 		     if
 2187: 			 is_record(R, vars, 2) andalso element(99, R) -> ok;
 2188: 			 true -> error
 2189: 		     end
 2190: 	     end)(),
 2191:     error = (fun(X) ->
 2192: 		     L = {a,b,c},
 2193: 		     if
 2194: 			 is_list(X) andalso length(L) > 4 -> ok;
 2195: 			 true -> error
 2196: 		     end
 2197: 	     end)([]),
 2198:     ok.
 2199: 
 2200: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso tuple_size(T) =:= 4 andalso element(1, T) =:= type andalso
 2201: 		 element(2, T) == integers ->
 2202:     element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 2203: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso tuple_size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= vector ->
 2204:     {X,Y} = element(2, T),
 2205:     if
 2206: 	is_float(X), is_float(Y) ->
 2207: 	    math:sqrt(X*X+Y*Y)
 2208:     end;
 2209: basic_rt(['+',A,B]) ->
 2210:     2*id(A+B);
 2211: basic_rt({R1,R2}) when erlang:size(R1) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set',
 2212: 		       erlang:size(R2) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set' ->
 2213:     R1 = id(R1),
 2214:     R2 = id(R2),
 2215:     R1;
 2216: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso tuple_size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= klurf ->
 2217:     3*id(element(2, T));
 2218: basic_rt(_) ->
 2219:     error.
 2220: 
 2221: traverse_dcd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2222:     L0 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0",a,b,c},{log_header,dcd_log,"2.0",a,b,c},
 2223: 	  {log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],
 2224:     {cont,[{log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],log,funny} = 
 2225: 	traverse_dcd({cont,L0}, log, funny),
 2226:     L1 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0"}],
 2227:     {cont,L1,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L1}, log, funny),
 2228:     L2 = [{a,tuple}],
 2229:     {cont,L2,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L2}, log, funny),
 2230:     ok.
 2231: 
 2232: %% The function starts out with 3 arguments in {x,0}, {x,1}, {x,2}.
 2233: %% The outer match of a two tuple will places the first element in {x,3} and
 2234: %% second in {x,4}. The guard for the first clause must make ensure that all of those
 2235: %% registers are restored before entering the second clause.
 2236: %%
 2237: %% (From mnesia_checkpoint.erl, modified.)
 2238: 
 2239: traverse_dcd({Cont,[LogH|Rest]},Log,Fun)
 2240:   when is_tuple(LogH) andalso tuple_size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 2241: andalso erlang:element(2,LogH) == dcd_log,
 2242: is_tuple(LogH) andalso tuple_size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 2243: andalso erlang:element(3,LogH) >= "1.0" ->
 2244:     traverse_dcd({Cont,Rest},Log,Fun);
 2245: traverse_dcd({Cont,Recs},Log,Fun) ->
 2246:     {Cont,Recs,Log,Fun}.
 2247: 
 2248: 
 2249: check_qlc_hrl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2250:     St = {r1,false,dum},
 2251:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3}], St),
 2252:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 2253:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [], St),
 2254:     St = cqlc(qlc, blurf, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 2255:     St = cqlc(q, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 2256:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b,c], St),
 2257:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [a,b], St),
 2258:     {r1,true,kalle} = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], {r1,true,kalle}),
 2259:     ok.
 2260: 
 2261: %% From erl_lint.erl; original name was check_qlc_hrl/4.
 2262: cqlc(M, F, As, St) ->
 2263:     Arity = length(As),
 2264:     case As of
 2265:         [{lc,_L,_E,_Qs}|_] when M =:= qlc, F =:= q, 
 2266:                                 Arity < 3, 
 2267:                                 not (((element(1, St) =:= r1) orelse fail) and (tuple_size(St) =:= 3) and element(2, St)) ->
 2268:             foo;
 2269:         _ ->
 2270:             St
 2271:     end.
 2272: 
 2273: %% OTP-7679: Thanks to Hunter Morris.
 2274: andalso_semi(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2275:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(0),
 2276:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(1),
 2277:     fc(catch andalso_semi_foo(2)),
 2278: 
 2279:     ok = andalso_semi_bar([a,b,c]),
 2280:     ok = andalso_semi_bar(1),
 2281:     fc(catch andalso_semi_bar([a,b])),
 2282: 
 2283:     ok = andalso_semi_dispatch(name, fun andalso_semi/1),
 2284:     ok = andalso_semi_dispatch(name, fun ?MODULE:andalso_semi/1),
 2285:     ok = andalso_semi_dispatch(name, {?MODULE,andalso_semi,1}),
 2286:     fc(catch andalso_semi_dispatch(42, fun andalso_semi/1)),
 2287:     fc(catch andalso_semi_dispatch(name, not_fun)),
 2288:     fc(catch andalso_semi_dispatch(name, fun andalso_semi_dispatch/2)),
 2289:     fc(catch andalso_semi_dispatch(42, {a,b})),
 2290: 
 2291:     ok.
 2292: 
 2293: andalso_semi_foo(Bar) when is_integer(Bar) andalso Bar =:= 0; Bar =:= 1 ->
 2294:    ok.
 2295: 
 2296: andalso_semi_bar(Bar) when is_list(Bar) andalso length(Bar) =:= 3; Bar =:= 1 ->
 2297:    ok.
 2298: 
 2299: andalso_semi_dispatch(Registry, MFAOrFun) when
 2300:       is_atom(Registry) andalso is_function(MFAOrFun, 1);
 2301:       is_atom(Registry) andalso tuple_size(MFAOrFun) == 3 ->
 2302:     ok.
 2303: 
 2304: t_tuple_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2305:     10 = do_tuple_size({1,2,3,4}),
 2306:     fc(catch do_tuple_size({1,2,3})),
 2307:     fc(catch do_tuple_size(42)),
 2308: 
 2309:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size({a,b,c}),
 2310:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size([a,b,c]),
 2311: 
 2312:     good_ip({1,2,3,4}),
 2313:     good_ip({1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8}),
 2314:     error = validate_ip({42,11}),
 2315:     error = validate_ip(atom),
 2316:     
 2317:     ok.
 2318: 
 2319: do_tuple_size(T) when tuple_size(T) =:= 4 ->
 2320:     {A,B,C,D} = T,
 2321:     A+B+C+D.
 2322: 
 2323: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2324:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#7777777777777777777777777777777777 -> ok;
 2325: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2326:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#10000000000000000 -> ok;
 2327: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2328:   when tuple_size(T) =:= (1 bsl 64) - 1 -> ok;
 2329: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 2330:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF -> ok;
 2331: ludicrous_tuple_size(_) -> error.
 2332: 
 2333: good_ip(IP) ->
 2334:     IP = validate_ip(IP).
 2335: 
 2336: validate_ip(Value) when is_tuple(Value) andalso
 2337:                         ((size(Value) =:= 4) orelse (size(Value) =:= 8)) ->
 2338:     %% size/1 (converted to tuple_size) used more than once.
 2339:     Value;
 2340: validate_ip(_) ->
 2341:     error.
 2342: 
 2343: %%
 2344: %% The binary_part/2,3 guard BIFs
 2345: %%
 2346: -define(MASK_ERROR(EXPR),mask_error((catch (EXPR)))).
 2347: mask_error({'EXIT',{Err,_}}) ->
 2348:     Err;
 2349: mask_error(Else) ->
 2350:     Else.
 2351: 
 2352: %% Test the binary_part/2,3 guard (GC) BIFs.
 2353: binary_part(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2354:     %% This is more or less a copy of what the guard_SUITE in emulator
 2355:     %% does to cover the guard bif's
 2356:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>),
 2357:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>),
 2358:     error = bptest(<<1>>),
 2359:     error = bptest(<<>>),
 2360:     error = bptest(apa),
 2361:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>),
 2362:     % With one variable (pos)
 2363:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 2364:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 2365:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1),
 2366:     error = bptest(<<>>,1),
 2367:     error = bptest(apa,1),
 2368:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1),
 2369:     % With one variable (length)
 2370:     1 = bptesty(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 2371:     2 = bptesty(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 2372:     error = bptesty(<<1>>,1),
 2373:     error = bptesty(<<>>,1),
 2374:     error = bptesty(apa,1),
 2375:     3 = bptesty(<<2,3,3>>,2),
 2376:     % With one variable (whole tuple)
 2377:     1 = bptestx(<<1,2,3>>,{1,1}),
 2378:     2 = bptestx(<<2,1,3>>,{1,1}),
 2379:     error = bptestx(<<1>>,{1,1}),
 2380:     error = bptestx(<<>>,{1,1}),
 2381:     error = bptestx(apa,{1,1}),
 2382:     3 = bptestx(<<2,3,3>>,{1,2}),
 2383:     % With two variables
 2384:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 2385:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 2386:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1,1),
 2387:     error = bptest(<<>>,1,1),
 2388:     error = bptest(apa,1,1),
 2389:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 2390:     % Direct (autoimported) call, these will be evaluated by the compiler...
 2391:     <<2>> = binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 2392:     <<1>> = binary_part(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 2393:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 2394:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<1>>,1,1)),
 2395:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<>>,1,1)),
 2396:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(apa,1,1)),
 2397:     <<3,3>> = binary_part(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 2398:     % Direct call through apply
 2399:     <<2>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1,2,3>>,1,1]),
 2400:     <<1>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,1,3>>,1,1]),
 2401:     % Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 2402:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1>>,1,1])),
 2403:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<>>,1,1])),
 2404:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[apa,1,1])),
 2405:     <<3,3>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,3,3>>,1,2]),
 2406:     % Constant propagation
 2407:      Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
 2408:      ok = if
 2409: 		    binary_part(Bin,1,1) =:= <<2>> ->
 2410: 			ok;
 2411: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 2412: 		    true ->
 2413: 			error
 2414: 		end,
 2415:      ok = if
 2416: 		    binary_part(Bin,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2417: 			ok;
 2418: 		    %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 2419: 		    true ->
 2420: 			error
 2421: 		end,
 2422:     error = bp_coverage_1(id(<<>>)),
 2423: 
 2424:     ok.
 2425: 
 2426: 
 2427: bptest(B) when length(B) =:= 1337 ->
 2428:     1;
 2429: bptest(B) when binary_part(B,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2430:     1;
 2431: bptest(B) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 2432:     2;
 2433: bptest(B)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2434:     3;
 2435: bptest(_) ->
 2436:     error.
 2437: 
 2438: bptest(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2439:     1;
 2440: bptest(B,A) when binary_part(B,{A,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2441:     1;
 2442: bptest(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 2443:     2;
 2444: bptest(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2445:     3;
 2446: bptest(_,_) ->
 2447:     error.
 2448: 
 2449: bptestx(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2450:     1;
 2451: bptestx(B,A) when binary_part(B,A) =:= <<2>> ->
 2452:     1;
 2453: bptestx(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 2454:     2;
 2455: bptestx(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2456:     3;
 2457: bptestx(_,_) ->
 2458:     error.
 2459: 
 2460: bptesty(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2461:     1;
 2462: bptesty(B,A) when binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2463:     1;
 2464: bptesty(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 2465:     2;
 2466: bptesty(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2467:     3;
 2468: bptesty(_,_) ->
 2469:     error.
 2470: 
 2471: bptest(B,A,_C) when length(B) =:= A ->
 2472:     1;
 2473: bptest(B,A,C) when binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<2>> ->
 2474:     1;
 2475: bptest(B,A,C) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,C) =:= <<1>> ->
 2476:     2;
 2477: bptest(B,A,C)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 2478:     3;
 2479: bptest(_,_,_) ->
 2480:     error.
 2481: 
 2482: bp_coverage_1(A) when binary_part(A, A, floor(float(0))) ->
 2483:     ok;
 2484: bp_coverage_1(_) ->
 2485:     error.
 2486: 
 2487: -define(FAILING(C),
 2488: 	if
 2489: 	    C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 2490: 	    true -> ok
 2491: 	end,
 2492: 	if
 2493: 	    true, C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 2494: 	    true -> ok
 2495: 	end).
 2496: 
 2497: bad_constants(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2498:     ?FAILING(false),
 2499:     ?FAILING([]),
 2500:     ?FAILING([a]),
 2501:     ?FAILING([Config]),
 2502:     ?FAILING({a,b}),
 2503:     ?FAILING({a,Config}),
 2504:     ?FAILING(<<1>>),
 2505:     ?FAILING(42),
 2506:     ?FAILING(3.14),
 2507:     ok.
 2508: 
 2509: bad_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2510:     if erlang:float(self()); true -> ok end,
 2511: 
 2512:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(1, [])),
 2513:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(1, [2])),
 2514:     fc(catch bad_guards_1(atom, [2])),
 2515: 
 2516:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [])),
 2517:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [x])),
 2518:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(not_a_map, [x])),
 2519:     fc(catch bad_guards_2(42, [x])),
 2520: 
 2521:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [])),
 2522:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(#{a=>0,b=>0}, [x])),
 2523:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(not_a_map, [x])),
 2524:     fc(catch bad_guards_3(42, [x])),
 2525: 
 2526:     fc(catch bad_guards_4()),
 2527: 
 2528:     {0,undefined} = bad_guards_5(id(<<>>), id(undefined)),
 2529: 
 2530:     ok.
 2531: 
 2532: %% beam_bool used to produce GC BIF instructions whose
 2533: %% Live operands included uninitialized registers.
 2534: 
 2535: bad_guards_1(X, [_]) when {{X}}, -X ->
 2536:     ok.
 2537: 
 2538: bad_guards_2(M, [_]) when M#{a := 0, b => 0}, map_size(M) ->
 2539:     ok.
 2540: 
 2541: %% beam_type used to produce an GC BIF instruction whose Live operand
 2542: %% included uninitialized registers.
 2543: 
 2544: bad_guards_3(M, [_]) when is_map(M) andalso M#{a := 0, b => 0}, length(M) ->
 2545:     ok.
 2546: 
 2547: %% v3_codegen would generate a jump to the failure label, but
 2548: %% without initializing x(0). The code at the failure label expected
 2549: %% x(0) to be initialized.
 2550: 
 2551: bad_guards_4() when not (error#{}); {not 0.0} -> freedom.
 2552: 
 2553: %% The JIT used to segfault when a guard rem instruction failed
 2554: %% with badarith AND a bif had been called just before it.
 2555: bad_guards_5(A, B) ->
 2556:     {byte_size(A), undefined = bad_guards_5_1(B)}.
 2557: bad_guards_5_1(A) when is_integer(A rem 255) ->
 2558:     A rem 255;
 2559: bad_guards_5_1(_) ->
 2560:     undefined.
 2561: 
 2562: %% Building maps in a guard in a 'catch' would crash v3_codegen.
 2563: 
 2564: guard_in_catch(_Config) ->
 2565:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(#{}),
 2566:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(#{a=>b}),
 2567:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_1(atom),
 2568: 
 2569:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(#{}),
 2570:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(#{a=>b}),
 2571:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_map_2(atom),
 2572: 
 2573:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch do_guard_in_catch_map_3()),
 2574: 
 2575:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(42),
 2576:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(<<1,2,3>>),
 2577:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(atom),
 2578:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = do_guard_in_catch_bin(#{}),
 2579: 
 2580:     ok.
 2581: 
 2582: do_guard_in_catch_map_1(From) ->
 2583:     catch
 2584: 	if
 2585: 	    From#{[] => sufficient} ->
 2586: 		saint
 2587: 	end.
 2588: 
 2589: do_guard_in_catch_map_2(From) ->
 2590:     catch
 2591: 	if
 2592: 	    From#{From => sufficient} ->
 2593: 		saint
 2594: 	end.
 2595: 
 2596: do_guard_in_catch_map_3() ->
 2597:     try
 2598: 	if [] -> solo end
 2599:     catch
 2600: 	Friendly when Friendly#{0 => []} -> minutes
 2601:     after
 2602: 	membership
 2603:     end.
 2604: 
 2605: do_guard_in_catch_bin(From) ->
 2606:     %% Would not crash v3_codegen, but there would be an unnecessary
 2607:     %% 'move' to a Y register.
 2608:     catch
 2609: 	if
 2610: 	    <<From:32>> ->
 2611: 		saint
 2612: 	end.
 2613: 
 2614: %%%
 2615: %%% The beam_bool pass has been eliminated. Here are the tests from
 2616: %%% beam_bool_SUITE, as well as new tests to test the new beam_ssa_bool
 2617: %%% module.
 2618: %%%
 2619: 
 2620: beam_bool_SUITE(_Config) ->
 2621:     before_and_inside_if(),
 2622:     scotland(),
 2623:     y_registers(),
 2624:     protected(),
 2625:     maps(),
 2626:     cover_shortcut_branches(),
 2627:     wrong_order(),
 2628:     megaco(),
 2629:     looks_like_a_guard(),
 2630:     fail_in_guard(),
 2631:     in_catch(),
 2632:     recv_semi(),
 2633:     andalso_repeated_var(),
 2634:     erl1246(),
 2635:     erl1253(),
 2636:     erl1384(),
 2637:     gh4788(),
 2638:     beam_ssa_bool_coverage(),
 2639:     bad_map_in_guard(),
 2640:     gh_6164(),
 2641:     gh_6184(),
 2642:     gh_7252(),
 2643:     gh_7339(),
 2644:     gh_7370(),
 2645:     gh_7517(),
 2646:     ok.
 2647: 
 2648: before_and_inside_if() ->
 2649:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [b], delete),
 2650:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [b], x),
 2651:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [], delete),
 2652:     no = before_and_inside_if([a], [], x),
 2653:     no = before_and_inside_if([], [], delete),
 2654:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [], x),
 2655:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [b], delete),
 2656:     yes = before_and_inside_if([], [b], x),
 2657: 
 2658:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [b], blah),
 2659:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [b], xx),
 2660:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [], blah),
 2661:     {ch1,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([a], [], xx),
 2662:     {no,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [b], blah),
 2663:     {no,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [b], xx),
 2664:     {ch1,no} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [], blah),
 2665:     {no,ch2} = before_and_inside_if_2([], [], xx),
 2666:     ok.
 2667: 
 2668: %% Thanks to Simon Cornish and Kostis Sagonas.
 2669: %% Used to crash beam_bool.
 2670: before_and_inside_if(XDo1, XDo2, Do3) ->
 2671:     Do1 = (XDo1 =/= []),
 2672:     Do2 = (XDo2 =/= []),
 2673:     if
 2674: 	%% This expression occurs in a try/catch (protected)
 2675: 	%% block, which cannot refer to variables outside of
 2676: 	%% the block that are boolean expressions.
 2677: 	Do1 =:= true;
 2678: 	Do1 =:= false, Do2 =:= false, Do3 =:= delete ->
 2679: 	    no;
 2680:        true ->
 2681: 	    yes
 2682:     end.
 2683: 
 2684: %% Thanks to Simon Cornish.
 2685: %% Used to generate code that would not set {y,0} on
 2686: %% all paths before its use (and therefore fail
 2687: %% validation by the beam_validator).
 2688: before_and_inside_if_2(XDo1, XDo2, Do3) ->
 2689:     Do1    = (XDo1 =/= []),
 2690:     Do2    = (XDo2 =/= []),
 2691:     CH1 = if Do1 == true;
 2692: 	     Do1 == false,Do2==false,Do3 == blah ->
 2693: 		  ch1;
 2694: 	     true ->
 2695: 		  no
 2696: 	  end,
 2697:     CH2 = if Do1 == true;
 2698: 	     Do1 == false,Do2==false,Do3 == xx ->
 2699: 		  ch2;
 2700: 	     true ->
 2701: 		  no
 2702: 	  end,
 2703:     {CH1,CH2}.
 2704: 
 2705: 
 2706: %% beam_bool would remove the initialization of {y,0}.
 2707: %% (Thanks to Thomas Arts and QuickCheck.)
 2708: 
 2709: scotland() ->
 2710:     million = do_scotland(placed),
 2711:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(false)),
 2712:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(true)),
 2713:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,placed},_}} = (catch do_scotland(echo)),
 2714:     ok.
 2715: 
 2716: do_scotland(Echo) ->
 2717:   found(case Echo of
 2718: 	    Echo when true; Echo, Echo, Echo ->
 2719: 		Echo;
 2720: 	    echo ->
 2721: 		[]
 2722: 	end,
 2723: 	Echo = placed).
 2724: 
 2725: found(_, _) -> million.
 2726: 
 2727: 
 2728: %% ERL-143: beam_bool could not handle Y registers as a destination.
 2729: y_registers() ->
 2730:     {'EXIT',{badarith,[_|_]}} = (catch baker(valentine)),
 2731:     {'EXIT',{badarith,[_|_]}} = (catch baker(clementine)),
 2732: 
 2733:     {not_ok,true} = potter([]),
 2734:     {ok,false} = potter([{encoding,any}]),
 2735: 
 2736:     ok.
 2737: 
 2738: %% Thanks to Quickcheck.
 2739: baker(Baker) ->
 2740:     (valentine == Baker) +
 2741: 	case Baker of
 2742: 	    Baker when Baker; Baker ->
 2743: 		Baker;
 2744: 	    Baker ->
 2745: 		[]
 2746: 	end.
 2747: 
 2748: %% Thanks to Jose Valim.
 2749: potter(Modes) ->
 2750:     Raw = lists:keyfind(encoding, 1, Modes) == false,
 2751:     Final = case Raw of
 2752: 		X when X == false; X == nil -> ok;
 2753: 		_ -> not_ok
 2754: 	    end,
 2755:     {Final,Raw}.
 2756: 
 2757: protected() ->
 2758:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch photographs({1, surprise, true}, opinions)),
 2759: 
 2760:     {{true}} = welcome({perfect, true}),
 2761:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch welcome({perfect, false})),
 2762:     ok.
 2763: 
 2764: photographs({_Violation, surprise, Deep}, opinions) ->
 2765:     {if
 2766: 	 0; "here", Deep ->
 2767: 	     Deep = Deep
 2768:      end}.
 2769: 
 2770: welcome({perfect, Profit}) ->
 2771:     if
 2772: 	Profit, Profit, Profit; 0 ->
 2773: 	    {id({Profit})}
 2774:     end.
 2775: 
 2776: maps() ->
 2777:     ok = evidence(#{0 => 42}).
 2778: 
 2779: %% Cover handling of put_map in split_block_label_used/2.
 2780: evidence(#{0 := Charge}) when 0; #{[] => Charge} == #{[] => 42} ->
 2781:     ok.
 2782: 
 2783: cover_shortcut_branches() ->
 2784:     ok = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, 0, 42, false),
 2785:     ok = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, 42, 42, true),
 2786:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, same, same, false),
 2787:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r1}, x, y, true),
 2788:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({r2}, 0, 42, false),
 2789:     error = cover_shortcut_branches({}, 0, 42, false),
 2790:     error = cover_shortcut_branches(not_tuple, 0, 42, false),
 2791:     ok.
 2792: 
 2793: cover_shortcut_branches(St, X, Y, Z) ->
 2794:     if
 2795:         %% The ((Y =:= X) =:= Z) part will test handling of a comparison
 2796:         %% operator followed by a one-way `br`.
 2797:         ((element(1, St) =:= r1) orelse fail) and ((Y =:= X) =:= Z) ->
 2798:             ok;
 2799:         true ->
 2800:             error
 2801:     end.
 2802: 
 2803: wrong_order() ->
 2804:     ok = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, true),
 2805:     ok = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, whatever),
 2806:     error = wrong_order(repeat_until_fail, false),
 2807:     error = wrong_order(nope, true),
 2808:     ok.
 2809: 
 2810: wrong_order(RepeatType, Mode) ->
 2811:     Parallel = Mode =/= false,
 2812:     RepeatStop = RepeatType =:= repeat_until_fail,
 2813:     if
 2814:         Parallel andalso RepeatStop ->
 2815:             ok;
 2816:         true ->
 2817:             error
 2818:     end.
 2819: 
 2820: megaco() ->
 2821:     ok = megaco('NULL', 0),
 2822:     ok = megaco('NULL', 7),
 2823:     ok = megaco('NULL', 15),
 2824:     ok = megaco('NULL', asn1_NOVALUE),
 2825:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 0),
 2826:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 7),
 2827:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 15),
 2828:     ok = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, asn1_NOVALUE),
 2829: 
 2830:     error = megaco(bad, 0),
 2831:     error = megaco(bad, 7),
 2832:     error = megaco(bad, 15),
 2833:     error = megaco(bad, asn1_NOVALUE),
 2834: 
 2835:     error = megaco('NULL', not_integer),
 2836:     error = megaco('NULL', -1),
 2837:     error = megaco('NULL', 16),
 2838:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, not_integer),
 2839:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, -1),
 2840:     error = megaco(asn1_NOVALUE, 16),
 2841: 
 2842:     error = megaco(bad, bad),
 2843:     error = megaco(bad, -1),
 2844:     error = megaco(bad, 42),
 2845: 
 2846:     ok.
 2847: 
 2848: megaco(Top, SelPrio)
 2849:   when (Top =:= 'NULL' orelse Top =:= asn1_NOVALUE) andalso
 2850:        ((is_integer(SelPrio) andalso ((0 =< SelPrio) and (SelPrio =< 15))) orelse
 2851: 	SelPrio =:= asn1_NOVALUE) ->
 2852:     ok;
 2853: megaco(_, _) ->
 2854:     error.
 2855: 
 2856: %% ERL-1054.
 2857: looks_like_a_guard() ->
 2858:     ok = looks_like_a_guard(0),
 2859:     ok = looks_like_a_guard(1),
 2860:     ok.
 2861: 
 2862: looks_like_a_guard(N) ->
 2863:     GuessPosition = id(42),
 2864:     %% The matching of `true` would look like a guard to
 2865:     %% beam_ssa_bool. The optimized code would not be safe.
 2866:     case {1 >= N, GuessPosition == 0} of
 2867:         {true, _} -> ok;
 2868:         {_, true} -> ok;
 2869:         _ -> looks_like_a_guard(N)
 2870:     end.
 2871: 
 2872: -record(fail_in_guard, {f}).
 2873: fail_in_guard() ->
 2874:     false = struct_or_map(a, "foo"),
 2875:     false = struct_or_map(a, foo),
 2876:     false = struct_or_map(#{}, "foo"),
 2877:     true = struct_or_map(#{}, foo),
 2878: 
 2879:     false = (fun() when whatever =/= (program andalso []) -> true;
 2880:                 () -> false
 2881:              end)(),
 2882:     false = if whatever =/= (program orelse []) -> true;
 2883:                true -> false
 2884:             end,
 2885: 
 2886:     %% Would crash the compiler if optimizing passes
 2887:     %% were disabled.
 2888:     error = if
 2889:                 0.1 orelse "VZ", 42 -> ok;
 2890:                 true -> error
 2891:             end,
 2892:     error = (fun() when 3.14; <<[]:(ceil($D))>> -> ok;
 2893:                () -> error
 2894:             end)(),
 2895:     error = fun() when eye; ""#fail_in_guard.f andalso #{[] => true and false} ->
 2896:                     ok;
 2897:                () ->
 2898:                     error
 2899:             end(),
 2900:     error = fun() when (0 #fail_in_guard.f)#fail_in_guard.f -> ok;
 2901:                () -> error
 2902:             end(),
 2903:     error = fun() when 42; <<0.5,0:(element(true, false))>> ->
 2904:                     a = b;
 2905:                () -> error
 2906:             end(),
 2907: 
 2908:     ok.
 2909: 
 2910: %% ERL-1183. If Name is not an atom, the `fail` atom must cause the
 2911: %% entire guard to fail.
 2912: struct_or_map(Arg, Name) when
 2913:       (is_map(Arg) andalso (is_atom(Name) orelse fail) andalso
 2914:        is_map_key(struct, Arg)) orelse is_map(Arg) -> true;
 2915: struct_or_map(_Arg, _Name) ->
 2916:     false.
 2917: 
 2918: in_catch() ->
 2919:     ok = in_catch(true),
 2920:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,false},[_|_]}} = in_catch(false),
 2921:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[_|_]}} = in_catch(any),
 2922:     ok.
 2923: 
 2924: in_catch(V) ->
 2925:     catch
 2926:         case false or V of
 2927:             true -> ok
 2928:         end.
 2929: 
 2930: recv_semi() ->
 2931:     timeout = id(receive
 2932:                      ok when home; <<(m#{}):false>> ->
 2933:                          ok
 2934:                  after 0 ->
 2935:                          timeout
 2936:                  end).
 2937: 
 2938: andalso_repeated_var() ->
 2939:     ok = andalso_repeated_var(true),
 2940:     error = andalso_repeated_var(false),
 2941:     error = andalso_repeated_var([not_boolean]),
 2942:     ok.
 2943: 
 2944: andalso_repeated_var(B) when B andalso B -> ok;
 2945: andalso_repeated_var(_) -> error.
 2946: 
 2947: -record(erl1246, {tran_stat = 0}).
 2948: 
 2949: erl1246() ->
 2950:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 0}, #{cid => 1131}),
 2951:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 12}, #{cid => 1131}),
 2952:     false = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 12}, #{cid => 9502}),
 2953:     true = erl1246(#erl1246{tran_stat = 0}, #{cid => 9502}),
 2954:     ok.
 2955: 
 2956: erl1246(Rec, #{cid := CollID}) ->
 2957:     {GiftCollID, _} = erl1246_conf(gift_coll),
 2958:     IsTranStat = Rec#erl1246.tran_stat =:= erl1246_conf(transform_id),
 2959:     if
 2960:         %% Optimization of 'not' in a guard was broken.
 2961:         CollID =:= GiftCollID andalso not IsTranStat ->
 2962:             true;
 2963:         true ->
 2964:             false
 2965:     end.
 2966: 
 2967: erl1246_conf(gift_coll) -> {9502, {112, 45}};
 2968: erl1246_conf(transform_id) -> 12;
 2969: erl1246_conf(_) -> undefined.
 2970: 
 2971: erl1253() ->
 2972:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, any),
 2973:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, true),
 2974:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, a, false),
 2975:     error = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, any),
 2976:     error = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, true),
 2977:     ok = erl1253_orelse_false(a, b, false),
 2978: 
 2979:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, any),
 2980:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, true),
 2981:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, a, false),
 2982:     error = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, any),
 2983:     ok = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, true),
 2984:     error = erl1253_orelse_true(a, b, false),
 2985: 
 2986:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, any),
 2987:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, true),
 2988:     ok = erl1253_andalso_false(a, a, false),
 2989:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, any),
 2990:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, true),
 2991:     error = erl1253_andalso_false(a, b, false),
 2992: 
 2993:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, any),
 2994:     ok = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, true),
 2995:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, a, false),
 2996:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, any),
 2997:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, true),
 2998:     error = erl1253_andalso_true(a, b, false),
 2999: 
 3000:     ok.
 3001: 
 3002: erl1253_orelse_false(X, Y, Z) ->
 3003:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_1(X, Y, Z),
 3004:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_2(X, Y, Z),
 3005:     Res = erl1253_orelse_false_3(X, Y, Z).
 3006: 
 3007: erl1253_orelse_false_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3008:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3009:     if
 3010:         X =:= Y orelse Bool -> ok;
 3011:         true -> error
 3012:     end.
 3013: 
 3014: erl1253_orelse_false_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3015:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3016:     if
 3017:         Bool orelse X =:= Y -> ok;
 3018:         true -> error
 3019:     end.
 3020: 
 3021: erl1253_orelse_false_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3022:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3023:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3024:     if
 3025:         Bool1 orelse Bool2 -> ok;
 3026:         true -> error
 3027:     end.
 3028: 
 3029: erl1253_orelse_true(X, Y, Z) ->
 3030:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_1(X, Y, Z),
 3031:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_2(X, Y, Z),
 3032:     Res = erl1253_orelse_true_3(X, Y, Z).
 3033: 
 3034: erl1253_orelse_true_1(X, Y, Z)   ->
 3035:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3036:     if
 3037:         X =:= Y orelse Bool -> ok;
 3038:         true -> error
 3039:     end.
 3040: 
 3041: erl1253_orelse_true_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3042:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3043:     if
 3044:         Bool orelse X =:= Y -> ok;
 3045:         true -> error
 3046:     end.
 3047: 
 3048: erl1253_orelse_true_3(X, Y, Z)   ->
 3049:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3050:     Bool2 = Z =:= true,
 3051:     if
 3052:         Bool1 orelse Bool2 -> ok;
 3053:         true -> error
 3054:     end.
 3055: 
 3056: erl1253_andalso_false(X, Y, Z) ->
 3057:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_1(X, Y, Z),
 3058:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_2(X, Y, Z),
 3059:     Res = erl1253_andalso_false_3(X, Y, Z).
 3060: 
 3061: erl1253_andalso_false_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3062:     Bool = Z =:= false,
 3063:     if
 3064:         X =:= Y andalso Bool -> ok;
 3065:         true -> error
 3066:     end.
 3067: 
 3068: erl1253_andalso_false_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3069:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3070:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3071:     if
 3072:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3073:         true -> error
 3074:     end.
 3075: 
 3076: erl1253_andalso_false_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3077:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3078:     Bool2 = Z =:= false,
 3079:     if
 3080:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3081:         true -> error
 3082:     end.
 3083: 
 3084: erl1253_andalso_true(X, Y, Z) ->
 3085:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_1(X, Y, Z),
 3086:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_2(X, Y, Z),
 3087:     Res = erl1253_andalso_true_3(X, Y, Z).
 3088: 
 3089: erl1253_andalso_true_1(X, Y, Z) ->
 3090:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3091:     if
 3092:         X =:= Y andalso Bool -> ok;
 3093:         true -> error
 3094:     end.
 3095: 
 3096: erl1253_andalso_true_2(X, Y, Z) ->
 3097:     Bool = Z =:= true,
 3098:     if
 3099:         Bool andalso X =:= Y-> ok;
 3100:         true -> error
 3101:     end.
 3102: 
 3103: erl1253_andalso_true_3(X, Y, Z) ->
 3104:     Bool1 = X =:= Y,
 3105:     Bool2 = Z =:= true,
 3106:     if
 3107:         Bool1 andalso Bool2 -> ok;
 3108:         true -> error
 3109:     end.
 3110: 
 3111: erl1384() ->
 3112:     gurka = erl1384_1(id(a)),
 3113:     gaffel = erl1384_1(id(b)),
 3114:     ok.
 3115: 
 3116: erl1384_1(V) ->
 3117:     case {id(false), V =/= a} of
 3118:         {true, true} -> not_reachable;
 3119:         {_, false} -> gurka;
 3120:         _ -> gaffel
 3121:     end.
 3122: 
 3123: gh4788() ->
 3124:     ok = do_gh4788(id(0)),
 3125:     ok = do_gh4788(id(1)),
 3126:     ok = do_gh4788(id(undefined)),
 3127:     lt_0_or_undefined = catch do_gh4788(id(-1)),
 3128:     ok.
 3129: 
 3130: do_gh4788(N) ->
 3131:     %% beam_ssa_bool would do an unsafe optimization when run after
 3132:     %% the beam_ssa_share pass.
 3133:     case {N >= 0, N == undefined} of
 3134:         {true, _} -> ok;
 3135:         {_, true} -> ok;
 3136:         _ -> throw(lt_0_or_undefined)
 3137:     end,
 3138:     ok.
 3139: 
 3140: beam_ssa_bool_coverage() ->
 3141:     {"*","abc"} = collect_modifiers("abc*", []),
 3142:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(true),
 3143: 
 3144:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(self()),
 3145:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(true),
 3146:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(false),
 3147:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(42),
 3148: 
 3149:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_3(42),
 3150:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_3(a),
 3151: 
 3152:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_4(42, 42),
 3153:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_4(ok, ok),
 3154:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_4(a, b),
 3155: 
 3156:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_5(ok),
 3157:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_5(2.0),
 3158:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_5(42),
 3159: 
 3160:     ok = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_6(<<>>),
 3161:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_6(a),
 3162:     error = beam_ssa_bool_coverage_6(42),
 3163: 
 3164:     ok.
 3165: 
 3166: collect_modifiers([H | T], Buffer)
 3167:     when (H >= $a andalso H =< $z) or
 3168:          (H >= $A andalso H =< $Z) ->
 3169:     collect_modifiers(T, [H | Buffer]);
 3170: collect_modifiers(Rest, Buffer) ->
 3171:     {Rest, lists:reverse(Buffer)}.
 3172: 
 3173: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(V) when V andalso 0, tuple_size(0) ->
 3174:     ok;
 3175: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_1(_) ->
 3176:     error.
 3177: 
 3178: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(A) when is_pid(A) andalso true; A ->
 3179:     ok;
 3180: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_2(_) ->
 3181:     error.
 3182: 
 3183: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_3(A) when ok; ((ok =< A + 1) or false) and true orelse ok ->
 3184:     ok;
 3185: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_3(_) ->
 3186:     error.
 3187: 
 3188: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_4(A, A) when ok == A andalso ok ->
 3189:     ok;
 3190: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_4(_, _) ->
 3191:     error.
 3192: 
 3193: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_5(A) ->
 3194:     maybe
 3195:         case case maybe ok end of
 3196:                  2.0 ->
 3197:                      false;
 3198:                  A ->
 3199:                      true;
 3200:                  _ ->
 3201:                      true
 3202:              end of
 3203:             true ->
 3204:                 ok;
 3205:             _ ->
 3206:                 error
 3207:         end
 3208:     end.
 3209: 
 3210: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_6(A) when is_bitstring(A) orelse ok;
 3211:                                  is_bitstring(A) andalso ok bsr ok ->
 3212:     ok;
 3213: beam_ssa_bool_coverage_6(_) ->
 3214:     error.
 3215:

 3224:     case 42 of

 3316: repeated_type_tests(_Config) ->
 3317:     binary = repeated_type_test(<<42>>),
 3318:     bitstring = repeated_type_test(<<1:1>>),
 3319:     other = repeated_type_test(atom),
 3320:     ok.
 3321: 
 3322: repeated_type_test(T) ->
 3323:     %% Test for a bug in beam_ssa_dead.
 3324:     if is_bitstring(T) ->
 3325:             if is_binary(T) ->                  %This test would be optimized away.
 3326:                     binary;
 3327:                true ->
 3328:                     bitstring
 3329:             end;
 3330:        true ->
 3331:             other
 3332:     end.
 3333: 
 3334: %% ERL-1179: The result of '=/=' would be flipped if it was used after being
 3335: %% branched on.
 3336: use_after_branch(_Config) ->
 3337:     {false, gaffel} = use_after_branch_1(foo),
 3338:     {true, gurka} = use_after_branch_1(bar),
 3339:     ok.
 3340: 
 3341: use_after_branch_1(A) ->
 3342:     Boolean = A =/= foo,
 3343:     case Boolean of
 3344:         true -> id(something);
 3345:         false -> id(other)
 3346:     end,
 3347:     case Boolean of
 3348:         true -> {id(Boolean), gurka};
 3349:         false -> {id(Boolean), gaffel}
 3350:     end.
 3351: 
 3352: %% GH-8733: Benign bug where {succeeded,body} was emitted in a guard context,
 3353: %% crashing the compiler when +no_bool_opt was specified.
 3354: body_in_guard(_Config) ->
 3355:     Pid = self(),
 3356:     Mon = monitor(process, Pid),
 3357:     receive
 3358:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} ->
 3359:             ok
 3360:     after 0 ->
 3361:         demonitor(Mon)
 3362:     end.
 3363: 
 3364: %% Call this function to turn off constant propagation.
 3365: id(I) -> I.
 3366: 
 3367: check(F, Result) ->
 3368:     case F() of
 3369: 	Result -> ok;
 3370: 	Other ->
 3371: 	    io:format("Expected: ~p\n", [Result]),
 3372: 	    io:format("     Got: ~p\n", [Other]),
 3373: 	    ct:fail(check_failed)
 3374:     end.
 3375: 
 3376: fc({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok.
